title: Hilbert's 12th Problem
content:
**Kronecker's Jugendtraum** ("Youthful Dream"):

> Find explicit generators for ALL abelian extensions of any number field K.

**Status by case**:
- K = ℚ: **SOLVED** (Kronecker-Weber: roots of unity)
- K = imaginary quadratic: **SOLVED** (Complex Multiplication)
- K = real quadratic: **OPEN** (Stark conjectures)
- K = general: **OPEN**

The dream: connect number theory to explicit analytic functions.

title: Abelian Extensions
content:
**Abelian Extension L/K**:

A field extension that is:
1. **Galois**: L/K is normal and separable
2. **Abelian Galois group**: Gal(L/K) is commutative

**Examples**:
- ℚ(√2)/ℚ has Gal = ℤ/2ℤ (abelian)
- ℚ(ζₙ)/ℚ has Gal = (ℤ/nℤ)× (abelian)
- Splitting field of x³-2 over ℚ is NOT abelian (Gal = S₃)

title: Kronecker-Weber Theorem
content:
**THE SOLUTION FOR ℚ**:

Every finite abelian extension of ℚ is contained in some cyclotomic field ℚ(ζₙ).

**In other words**: The ONLY way to build an abelian extension of ℚ is to adjoin roots of unity!

**Proof**: Uses local class field theory at each prime p.

This completely solves Hilbert 12 for K = ℚ.
mathContext: L/ℚ abelian ⟹ L ⊆ ℚ(ζₙ) for some n

title: Cyclotomic Galois Groups
content:
**Key Fact**: Cyclotomic extensions have abelian Galois groups!

$$\text{Gal}(\mathbb{Q}(\zeta_n)/\mathbb{Q}) \cong (\mathbb{Z}/n\mathbb{Z})^\times$$

**Why?** Each automorphism σ sends ζₙ ↦ ζₙᵏ for some k coprime to n.

The map σ ↦ k gives the isomorphism. Since multiplication in (ℤ/nℤ)× is commutative, so is the Galois group.

**Proven in Lean** using `IsCyclotomicExtension.autEquivPow`.

title: Cyclotomic Degree
content:
**Theorem**: The degree of the cyclotomic extension equals Euler's totient:

$$[\mathbb{Q}(\zeta_n) : \mathbb{Q}] = \varphi(n)$$

This follows from the irreducibility of the nth cyclotomic polynomial Φₙ(x) over ℚ.

**Examples**:
- [ℚ(ζ₄):ℚ] = φ(4) = 2
- [ℚ(ζ₇):ℚ] = φ(7) = 6

title: Complex Multiplication
content:
**THE SOLUTION FOR IMAGINARY QUADRATIC FIELDS**:

For K = ℚ(√-d), abelian extensions come from:

1. **j-invariant**: j(τ) generates the Hilbert class field
2. **Torsion points**: Coordinates of n-torsion on CM elliptic curves
3. **Weber functions**: Special values at division points

This is Kronecker's original dream realized!

**Key insight**: Elliptic curves with complex multiplication by K provide the explicit generators.

title: Class Field Theory
content:
**Abstract Classification**:

Class field theory tells us abelian extensions EXIST and classifies them via:

$$\text{Gal}(K^{\text{ab}}/K) \cong \hat{C}_K / K^\times$$

(idele class group)

**BUT**: This doesn't give EXPLICIT generators!

Hilbert 12 asks for the explicit analytic functions — that's the hard part.

title: What Remains Open
content:
**Real Quadratic Fields**: K = ℚ(√d), d > 0

NO analogue of CM theory exists! The Stark conjectures give conjectural answers using L-function special values.

**General Number Fields**:

Modern approaches:
1. **Stark Conjectures**: Units from L-values
2. **Langlands Program**: Automorphic↔Galois
3. **Higher CM**: Abelian varieties

No complete solution for general K!

title: Concrete Examples
content:
**Cyclotomic Field Examples**:

- ℚ(i) = ℚ(ζ₄): The 4th roots of unity
- ℚ(ω) = ℚ(ζ₃): The cube roots of unity (ω = e^(2πi/3))
- ℚ(√-3) = ℚ(ζ₃): Same field!

**Key fact**: The nth cyclotomic polynomial Φₙ(x) is irreducible over ℚ.

Proven in Lean: `cyclotomic.irreducible_rat`

title: Stark Conjectures
content:
**Modern Approach (1970s-80s)**:

Predict that special values of L-functions at s=0 are related to **Stark units** that generate abelian extensions.

$$L'(s, \chi) \Big|_{s=0} = \text{(regulator of Stark units)}$$

For real quadratic fields, Stark units would solve Hilbert 12!

**Status**: Proven in special cases, general conjectures remain OPEN.

title: Problem Status
content:
**Hilbert 12: Partially Solved**

**Solved**:
- ℚ: Kronecker-Weber (1886)
- Imaginary quadratic: CM theory

**Open**:
- Real quadratic: Stark conjectures
- General: No solution

**Why it's hard**: Class field theory gives abstract classification but not explicit generators. The connection to analysis (exp for ℚ, elliptic curves for imaginary quadratic) doesn't generalize.
